Chasin'_Crazy:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Dorado | image = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | alias = | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], [[United States]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2012-present | label = RPM Entertainment | associated_acts = | website = {{url|http://chasincrazy.com/}} | current_members = Landon Parker
Travis Fincher
Jimmy James Hunter
Creigh Riepe
Forest Miller | past_members = }} '''Chasin' Crazy''' is an American [[country music]] group composed of Landon Parker (acoustic guitar, vocals), Travis Fincher (drums, vocals), Jimmy James Hunter (lead guitar, vocals), Creigh Riepe (keyboards, guitar, vocals) and Forest Miller (bass, fiddle, mandolin, vocals).{{cite web|title=Chasin' Crazy Biography|url=http://www.gactv.com/gac/ar_artists_a-z/article/0,3028,GAC_26071_6074869_,00.html|website=[[Great American Country]]|accessdate=December 11, 2014|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20141211151229/http://www.gactv.com/gac/ar_artists_a-z/article/0,3028,GAC_26071_6074869_,00.html|archivedate=December 11, 2014}} The group was formed in [[Nashville, Tennessee]] in 2012.{{cite news|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling|title=Chasin' Crazy Talk Chaos of Reality Show, the Boy Band Label and Why the Music Speaks for Itself|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/chasin-crazy-new-single-reality-show-interview/|accessdate=December 11, 2014|work=[[Taste of Country]]|date=October 16, 2014}} They signed to RPM Entertainment and released their debut single, "That's How We Do Summertime", in May 2014. The song was written by Thomas Matthew Karlas and Matthew Thomas Ramsey and produced by [[Marti Frederiksen]] and [[Blake Chancey]].{{cite news|last1=Papadatos|first1=Markos|title=Review: Chasin' Crazy delight on 'That's How We Do Summertime' single|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/review-chasin-crazy-delight-on-that-s-how-we-do-summertime-single/article/408374|accessdate=December 11, 2014|work=Digital Journal|date=October 13, 2014}} Markos Papadatos of ''Digital Journal'' gave "That's How We Do Summertime" four stars out of five. Papadatos called it "the quintessential summer anthem," writing that "the song has a liberating theme to it" and "the harmonies and backing vocals in the song are quite infectious." The song also received a favorable review from ''[[Taste of Country]]'', stating that it is "infectious and up-tempo, distinguishing their country-pop sound from other three-plus outfits." The review went on to say that "the lyrics may lean generic, but a sweet guitar melody and strong vocal harmonies carry the song through" and "Parker’s got a strong voice to lead the track, although all five guys share singing duties during each chorus."{{cite news|title=Chasin' Crazy, 'That's How We Do Summertime' [Listen]|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/chasin-crazy-thats-how-we-do-summertime/|accessdate=December 11, 2014|work=[[Taste of Country]]|date=June 17, 2014}} "That's How We Do Summertime" debuted at number 59 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart for the week of May 31, 2014 and charted for thirteen weeks, peaking at number 47 for the week of August 9.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/search/charts?f%5B0%5D=ts_chart_artistname%3A%2AChasin%27%20Crazy%2A&f%5B1%5D=itm_field_chart_id%3A1226&f%5B2%5D=ss_bb_type%3Achart_item&type=2&artist=Chasin%27%20Crazy|title=Chasin' Crazy Album & Song Chart History - Country Airplay|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=December 11, 2014}} A music video for the song was released on August 12.{{cite news|last1=Stefano|first1=Angela|title=Chasin' Crazy, 'That's How We Do Summertime' Video — Exclusive Premiere|url=http://theboot.com/chasin-crazy-thats-how-we-do-summertime-video/|accessdate=December 11, 2014|work=The Boot|date=August 12, 2014}} Chasin' Crazy released their second single, "Smack Dab", in August. Both songs will be included on an [[extended play]] to be released in early 2015. A [[reality show]] about the band, also called ''Chasin' Crazy'', premiered on [[Great American Country]] on October 11, 2014.{{cite news|last1=Paxman|first1=Bob|title=Get Ready for New GAC Series "Chasin' Crazy"|url=http://www.countryweekly.com/news/get-ready-new-gac-series-chasin-crazy|accessdate=December 11, 2014|work=[[Country Weekly]]|date=October 8, 2014}} ==Discography== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Single !
